Reviews.Title: Awesome Outdoor Photos, But Indoor Photos Takes Some Tweeking
Reviews.Author: Kim Cantrell "Soap Box Bandit"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after having a Fujifilm FinePix 2650 2MP Digital Camera w/ 3x Optical Zoom for years that I LOVED and it took awesome photos with very little effort (I'm very much the amatuer photographer).I've been a bit disappointed in this newer Fujifilm camera, however, as it's not so easy to use.Taking outdoor photos is a breeze.  And with 8 megapixels, the shots are very clear and full of detail.  However, you can't just click and shoot with indoor photos; to get the best quality you really must read and understand the users manual.  Even then, it still takes a great deal of tweeking to get the perfect photo.I highly recommend purchasing a memory card as the internal disk does not hold many photos.

Reviews.Title: very dissapointed customer
Reviews.Author: Ramon Enrique Berliza Yorro
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item and i am frustrated. horrible image and i can not transfer the pictures to my pc. I would like to return thsi camera to the seller. i spent my money in this estupid used camera and now no money no camera.

Reviews.Title: Was OK......When it worked
Reviews.Author: SARG
Reviews.Content: It appears from looking around the net that these cameras have a common problem. They simply fail to turn on which makes them an ugly paperweight. Mine worked for about one week.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix A850 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Lois
Reviews.Content: I chose the highest rating because I was so pleased that I could find this camera on Amazon.com. My husband had taken my first Fujifilm Finepix A850, drooped it and the lens was broken. I have been searching for this particular camera because I found it user friendly and not difficult as some others. I will be ordering more products in the future.ThankYous

Reviews.Title: Great Bang for the Buck
Reviews.Author: Walter Costescu
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I don't know much about cameras, but it just works the way I want it to. It has a nice big screen, feels solid, is pretty intuitive, not complicated and takes great photos! What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: J. Mansell "JGM"
Reviews.Content: This Fuji uses standard SD cards which makes it just as handy as any other camera (Fuji finally got away from expensive xD cards).  I like the feel of the camera because it doesn't feel like a cube of platic, it feels like a real camera should. I have had no problems with the picture quality the other reviewers mentioned. I also find it quite easy to navigate. It seems to have good battery life and has been very reliable and inexpensive to use since it takes only 2 AA batteries.  I would rate this camera at 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Sam Bleuel
Reviews.Content: This camera is very thick and heavy. Not something I'd recommend taking walking around, compared to slimmer cameras.The battery life is also horrible. I take a few photos a day, for a couple days, and the batteries need changing. I always have to take spare batteries while going out with this camera.If it's really sunny out, the photos are over-exposed. Often get red eyes, even with the red eye reduction.It's OK outside if it's not too sunny or too dark.It takes horrible indoor photos, it's ALWAYS grainy.The pictures never look like the scene they're captured in, no matter what setting you choose. (I've had problems with all of them)I cannot take clear photos of up close things like jewelry and things like that. The photos come out fuzzy and blurry most of the time.Don't even think about cropping photos, they're even more grainy than normal photos.I paid $100 for this and it's not even worth that! There's tons of cameras on eBay for that price WAY better than this one.I DON'T RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA FOR ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: Not worth $60
Reviews.Author: Daniel Night "Do to others as you would have ...
Reviews.Content: It's really hard to get good photos with this camera and it has some major distortion problems. Pricing it over $70 is a stretch, and over $200, how absurd unless it's pristine and for a gallery of camera types of some sort. You can expect every picture you get from this thing, to, half the time be plagued with graininess. It's very poor in low light conditions and the lens is easy to scratch. Look elsewhere for a low budget quality camera.

ProductInfo.Features:
8.0-megapixel resolution captures enough detail for photo-quality 16x 22-inch prints
3x wide-angle optical zoom; Mega Optical Image Stabilized
2.5-inch LCD screen; Face Detection
Intelligent ISO; Intelligent Scene Selector
captures images to SD memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm Finepix A850 Digital Camera 8.1 Megapixels 3x Optical Zoom ISO800 (Picture Stabilization) 2.5-inch LCD
